intro: Cliffortia discolor, commonly known as the white-flowered cliffortia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. Cliffortia discolor is often found in mountainous regions and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
